Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii2136
Reviews.Content: This hostal is located super close to Puerta del Sol. The staff doesn't speak very much English (except Alan who does and is very friendly and helpful), but they all seemed nice and eager to help. The room was small but had AC and a balcony. The bed was a bit uncomfortable, but overall I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Hot water, please.”
Reviews.Author: Philippe_Lavoipierre
Reviews.Content: There was almost no hot water over our four-night stay. Aside from the very last morning at 6:30 when the water was acceptably hot, it did not get more than lukewarm. And this while air temperatures were down to nearly zero at night in this uncharacteristically chilly April. On one of these nights the heat in the hostal was not turned on. I alerted the manager, who suggested that many people had been using the hot water that morning, but even at off-peak hours, it was only tepid at best. There were in any case hardly any guests besides us. Unfortunate because the establishment is otherwise clean and friendly and the location is perfect. At this price-point I don't expect luxury, but a reasonable supply of hot water is not too much to ask for, I think. Next time I will seek accommodation elsewhere in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CarlyAlexandra
Reviews.Content: Great location right by Sol, the city center. The hostel was so clean and the staff couldn't be more helpful. They gave us maps and were available in the hostel at all hours, unlike other hostels where the staff in no where to be found. We got the room for 35 eur for the night last minute, and it was a great value in my opinion. The place isn't luxurious, but it suited our needs for the layover between cities.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good price & near metro”
Reviews.Author: Theresa_Isabel_R
Reviews.Content: Very basic hostel but good value for money. The rooms are not flash but quite neat. The receptionist is helpful and can speak good English, even booked a taxi for us for the next day when we had to leave at 4am to get to the airport. The hostel is very close to the metro, literally 2 mins walk. The area is ok, at night is full of dodgy people on the streets and outside the metro but seemed harmless. Maybe just dont walk around by yourself. I lost my camera in madrid and have a feeling it was stolen from my handbag in this area as it can get a bit busy, The place is only a few stops to the city. Very close to La Latina, good for tapas... very lively place. The only problem we had was that we got to Madrid pretty early 7am and the hostel didnt open til around 9am. No one opened the door even when we kept pressing the door bell, We had to wait around 2 hours in a cafe. Otherwise good hostal and will probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price - excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: CoxG
Reviews.Content: Friendly owners and although the hotel was pretty much full - didn't have a problem with queuing for the shared bathroom. My room did face inwards and I had the constant smell of fried food coming in my window - but better than facing a nightclub! It was pretty quiet, and very clean. Highly recommended if you're looking for a budget place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, hot and noisy but clean”
Reviews.Author: TyDyeDillo
Reviews.Content: We had a very small room with two beds and a sink with the full bathroom down the hall. An AC unit was installed but disabled at the time of our visit. This place is definitely shabby but very clean and the staff was friendly. Weird decor. Renovations in the building are very loud starting early in the morning and the walls are the usual variety of paper thin expected from places in this price range. Walking distance to all the sights and nightlife, metro station at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Really recommend”
Reviews.Author: Claire27
Reviews.Content: We had a great three night stay at this hostel. We had a double room with balcony. Shower and sink were in the bathroom and toilets down the corridor. It was very clean. Good warddrobe space. Bright and airy. It is safe. Its on the fourth floor (has a lift) so when looking for it on the street look up! The owners and staff were lovely. It is not a fun hip hostel so if thats what you want stay elsewhere but it is perfect for a couple or for a nice relaxing and quiet stay. We had a plasma flat screen TV too! There is a shop outside the front door and the metro stop is just across the road so its location is great and convenient to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Correct for what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Truska
Reviews.Content: I would have preferred to be in other hostels from the area (by now I know quite a few). I booked this hostel because it was too late and everything was full. Nevertheless, it was worth for the price we were paying for the bedroom. Everything was correct. Although the bedrooms and shared bathrooms were old, they were always clean. People working there were very agreeable and helpful. Excellent location.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Fabiola
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Doctor Cortezo 15, 4-D, 28012 Madrid, Spain
